description.value:
Totem of Fenris

Totem Spirit (War) — Creation Cost: 9 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Fury / Destruction / Ruthlessness

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Fenris, the pack must confront a spirit that embodies annihilation, predation, and merciless warfare. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Doom-Wolf Spirit (Fenris Aspect) — Suggested base: Dire Werewolf Alpha–style spirit (CR 11–13)
  • Shadow Mastiff Pack Lord (Spirit-Empowered) — Suggested base: Shadow Mastiff (CR 9–10), reflavored as an Umbra predator
  • Apocalyptic War-Beast Spirit — Suggested base: Yugoloth or Fiend stat block (CR 8+), stripped of planar allegiance and treated as a pure spirit of destruction

These spirits are rarely willing. Submission is typically earned through dominance, endurance, or total victory.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus
  • Once per turn, when you hit a creature that is below half its hit point maximum, you deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Fenris' hunger.

For 1 minute, while within 20 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain advantage on their first attack roll each turn against a creature that has already taken damage this round
  • Once during the duration, when a pack member reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points, another pack member may immediately make one weapon attack as a reaction

This represents Fenris driving the pack to finish what it starts.

Ban — No Mercy for the Hated

Fenris demands absolute destruction of declared enemies.

Once the pack has declared a creature or faction as an enemy, they must not spare, negotiate with, or retreat from that enemy while victory is reasonably possible.

Showing mercy, hesitation, or restraint toward a sworn foe causes the Totem to become dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Fenris may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
